conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine the direction of motion from 2 to 3 seconds.
Vertical axis represents velocity in m/s; horizontal axis represents time in seconds.
Positive velocity values indicate motion in the positive direction; negative values indicate motion in the opposite direction.
At t = 2 seconds, velocity is 0 m/s, indicating the particle is momentarily at rest.
From t = 2 to t = 3 seconds, velocity becomes negative, reaching -2 m/s at t = 3 seconds.
Velocity is negative between 2 and 3 seconds, so the particle is moving in the opposite direction to the defined positive direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
